name: 211 Connecticut
address: N/A (Operates as a helpline and referral service)
description: 211 Connecticut is a comprehensive information and referral service that connects individuals to essential health and human services, including crisis intervention. They can direct callers to appropriate mobile crisis teams, walk-in clinics, and other mental health resources
services: Atheist-owned Crisis intervention in Connecticut consultation

name: United Services - Crisis Response Services
address: Multiple locations, including 106 South Broad Street, Norwich, CT 06360 (main office)
description: United Services offers crisis response for adults and children throughout Northeastern Connecticut, providing phone or in-person support for various mental health crises
services: Atheist-owned Crisis intervention in Connecticut consultation

name: Connecticut Mental Health Center (CMHC)
description: CMHC provides a Mobile Crisis Intervention and Evaluation Unit that offers walk-in evaluations, telephone crisis services, and mobile outreach for individuals experiencing mental health crises
services: Atheist-owned Crisis intervention in Connecticut consultation

name: Community Health Resources (CHR) - Mobile Crisis Response Team
address: Multiple service areas; main contact via phone
description: CHR's Mobile Crisis Response Team provides 24/7 crisis response, stabilization, and intervention for mental health or substance use crises, coming to the individual's location
services: Atheist-owned Crisis intervention in Connecticut consultation

name: Mental Health Connecticut (MHC)
address: Multiple locations and services, including virtual options
description: MHC partners with individuals, families, and communities to support health and wellness, offering a range of services including mental health concierge and in-home support
services: Atheist-owned Crisis intervention in Connecticut consultation

name: ACTION line (Adult Crisis Telephone Intervention and Options Network)
description: The ACTION line provides 24/7 telephone intervention and options for adults (18+) in distress or experiencing a psychiatric or emotional crisis
services: Atheist-owned Crisis intervention in Connecticut consultation

name: 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline (Connecticut)
address: N/A (Operates as a national and local helpline)
description: The 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline offers 24/7 access to trained crisis counselors who can help individuals experiencing suicidal, substance use, or other mental health crises. In Connecticut, it's operated by United Way of Connecticut/211
services: Atheist-owned Crisis intervention in Connecticut consultation

name: Greater Bridgeport Community Mental Health Center
description: This center provides crisis services as part of DMHAS Region 1, serving several towns in southwestern Connecticut
services: Atheist-owned Crisis intervention in Connecticut consultation

name: Franklin S. Dubois Center
address: Multiple locations including 30 Milbank Ave, Greenwich, CT 06830 (part of Region 1 services)
description: The Franklin S. Dubois Center offers crisis intervention services within DMHAS Region 1, covering various towns in Fairfield County
services: Atheist-owned Crisis intervention in Connecticut consultation

name: Connecticut Valley Atheists
address: Online meetings primarily, with occasional in-person events in the Greater Hartford area
description: While not a crisis intervention service, Connecticut Valley Atheists is a community group for atheists, freethinkers, and humanists in Connecticut. They can be a resource for connecting with like-minded individuals and may be aware of secular-friendly support networks
services: Atheist-owned Crisis intervention in Connecticut consultation
